alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 3:01PM EST until December 17 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, Columbus and northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 301 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whiteville, Tabor City, Chadbourn, Bethel, Lake Waccamaw, Fair Bluff, Boardman, Williams, Sidney, Clarendon, Southeastern Community College, Mollie, Nakina, Redbug, Cherry Grove, Hallsboro, Old Dock, Evergreen, Dulah and Bughill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
